Name of Action: Department of Ed issues joint letter to Columbia University demanding steps in response to what ED calls Antisemitism

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Initiates Reduction in Force

Name of Action: Federal reduction in force buyout offers

Name of Action: OCR Dear Colleague letter on race-conscious policies and practices
Topic: Research Funding, DEI, Civil Rights, Program Funding, Regulations, Curriculum, Academic Freedom, PK-12 School Funding, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Threatens to withhold funding from PK-20 educational institutions and organizations that include race as a factor in any decisions or programming. Gives institutions 14 days to comply.
What It Means: Not legally binding. Still, institutions are working to assess implications of the letter and whether and to what extent they need to comply.
News & Commentary: AFT sues Education Department over anti-DEI guidance | Higher Ed Dive
Notes: AFT bringing suit against ED (Column K). NEA and ACLU bringing suit against ED (Column M).

Name of Action: Linda McMahon HELP Confirmation Hearing
Topic: Department of Education
What It Says: Relatively short hearing. Great deal of pushback from Dems. Generally strong support and unity from GOP.
What It Means: Little pushback from GOP makes confirmation even more likely.
Challenges to Action: Several interuptions of hearing by hecklers.

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education cancels $350 million in contracts with Regional Education Laboratories
Topic: PK-12 School Funding, Postsecondary Funding, Program Funding, DEI, Research Funding
What It Says: Canceled contracts with Regional Education Laboratories, which provide technical assistance to schools.
What It Means: Claims that these agencies provide too much assistance for equity-focused work like equity audits.
Primary Source Title: U.S. Department of Education Cancels Additional $350 Million in Woke Spending

Name of Action: Layoffs of Probationary Federal Employees
Topic: Federal Workforce, Regulations, Civil Rights
What It Says: Layoffs of probationary employees from ED, Bureau of Indian Education, CFPB
What It Means: Beginning of major reduction in ED workforce. Implications for OCR, financial aid, legal, communications.
Status: 3/13 rulling by federal judge reinstates employees at Veterans Affairs, Agriculture, Defense, Energy, Interior, and Treasury. Does not cover ED, but judge could extend ruling to those employees.
Challenges to Action: Pueblo of Isleta v Secretary of the Department of the Interior
News & Commentary: Tribal funding caught in crossfire from Trump administration - ICT News
Notes: Thousands of probationary employees fired as Trump administration directs agencies to carry out widespread layoffs | CNN Politics
Additional Info: Student loan borrowers misled by colleges were about to get relief. Trump fired people poised to help

Name of Action: U.S. State Department freezes funding for study abroad programs, including Fulbright
Topic: Research Funding, Program Funding, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary, International Education
What It Says: Actions claims that program funding was frozen pending a 14-day review, but that window expired on February 27, 2025.
What It Means: Funding freeze has impacted tens of thousands of scholars, with some of them stranded outside their home countries.
Status: Many organizations and institutions report that funding is still frozen.
News & Commentary: Statement: Suspension of International Education and Exchange Program Funding Threatens U.S. Economic and National Security | NAFSA
Additional Info: Scholars stranded in America and abroad amid funding freeze of State Department programs | AP News

Name of Action: Establishing the President's Make America Healthy Again Commission
Topic: Regulations, Healthcare, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Assessing "prevalence and threats posed" by mental health treatments like medications, particularly for minors.
What It Means: Questioning mental health professionals' ability to treat children.

Name of Action: U.S Department of Education changes Name, Image, and Likeness (NIL) compensation regulations
Topic: DEI, Title IX, Civil Rights, Postsecondary
What It Says: Rescinds Biden admin regulations that required NIL money from college sports to be distributed equally among male and female athletes. Claims Title IX does not apply to NIL.
What It Means: Trump adminstration casting aside gender pay equity in collegiate atheletics.
News & Commentary: Dept. of Education revokes guidance on Title IX and athlete pay - ESPN
Primary Source Title: U.S Department of Education Rescinds Biden 11th Hour Guidance on NIL Compensation

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Launches Investigation into Two Athletics Organizations
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Regulations, Postsecondary, State Jurisdiction
What It Says: Investigations into associations in Minnesota and California for allowing students to compete in sports events that conform to their gender identity.
What It Means: More attacks on trans students and athletes. Ongoing legal battles put state athletic associations in a complex position.
News & Commentary: The U.S. Department of Education targets two athletic associations over girls' and women's sports

Name of Action: Department of Education launches investigation into 5 VA school districts' trans athelete policies
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Regulations, PK-12 Schools, State Jurisdiction
What It Says: Pursuent to a complaint filed by America First Legal Foundation alleging that the five districts continue to support trans athlete participation in sports.
What It Means: ED is pursuing complaints filed by independent entitities.
News & Commentary: Education Department investigating Northern Virginia school districts for transgender support policies
Notes: Primary source is ED letter to America First Legal Foundation.

Name of Action: Nomination of Kirsten Baesler for Assistant Secretary for Elementary and Secondary Education
Topic: Federal Workforce, Department of Education
What It Says: Description in title.
News & Commentary: CCSSO Releases Statement on Nomination of Assistant Secretary for Elementary and Secondary Education

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Urges the NCAA, National Federation of State High School Associations to strip trans athletes of their records
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Title IX, Civil Rights, Postsecondary
What It Says: Description in title.
What It Means: Continued attacks on trans students and athletes.
Primary Source Title: "U.S. Department of Education Urges the NCAA, NFHS to Restore Female Athletics Records Wrongfully Erased By Male Competitors"

Name of Action: DOGE cancelation of IES projects
Topic: Research Funding, Federal Workforce, Program Funding
What It Says: Terminated 89 contracts with agencies that do research for IES. Also terminated data collection and US participation in PISA.
What It Means: Potential forthcoming huge gaps in data sets and statistical research. Major hit to orgs that do federally contracted research, like NCES, Mathematica, and IES.
News & Commentary: AERA and COPAFS Statement on the New Administration’s Sudden Termination of National Center for Education Statistics Contracts

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education changes reporting regulations for Career and Technical Education Programs
Topic: PK-12 Schools, Postsecondary, Regulations
What It Says: Rescinds Biden admin regulations under the Perkins Act for data collection and reporting by CTE programs.
What It Means: The Biden changes were unpopular and even faced opposition from groups like AASA.
News & Commentary: Education Department reverses CTE policies after criticism | K-12 Dive
Primary Source Title: "U.S. Department of Education Reduces Burden on Career and Technical Education Programs"

Name of Action: Supplemental Guidance to the 2024 NIH Grants Policy Statement: Indirect Cost Rates
Topic: Research Funding, Program Funding, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: TRO extended March 5.
What It Means: Would have enormous impact on higher education research.
Challenges to Action: Association of American Universities v. Department of Health & Human Services, 1:25-cv-10346 – CourtListener.com
News & Commentary: AAU Legally Challenges Cuts to Life-Saving NIH Research
Additional Info: Commonwealth of Massachusetts v. National Institutes of Health, 1:25-cv-10338 – CourtListener.com
Fallout: Also a lawsuit from 22 attorneys general.

Name of Action: DoD starts restricting learning materials in DoD schools
Topic: DEI, PK-12 Schools, Federal Workforce
What It Says: Restricting materials that DoD deems out of compliance with DEI Executive Order.
What It Means: Banning materials.

Name of Action: DOGE obtains administrator email accounts from Dept of Education
Topic: Department of Education, Federal Workforce
What It Says: DOGE claims they need access to data to find waste and fraud in programs.
What It Means: No real justification for why personal data would be helpful in assessing fraud and waste.
Status: on 2/24, judge issued injunction on ED sharing personal information with DOGE. Impacts both the student and worker cases.
News & Commentary: Judge blocks Department of Education, federal personnel office from sharing data with DOGE
Notes: Challenges brought by both University of California Student Association (to block DOGE access to loan data) and federal workers unions to block sharing of worker person information.

Name of Action: Dept of Education blocks entry by Democratic lawmakers
Topic: Federal Workforce, Department of Education
What It Says: Democratic lawmakers wished to meet with Denise Carter to discuss potential adminstration cuts to programs.
What It Means: No explanation given for blocking access.
News & Commentary: Education Department’s doors blocked to House Democrats | K-12 Dive

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education launches investigations into institutions that support trans student athletes
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Title IX, Civil Rights, Postsecondary
What It Says: Investigations into schools that allowed trans women to compete in women's sports. Includes San Jose State University, University of Pennsylvania, Massachusetts Interscholastic Atheletics Association.
What It Means: Part of ongoing anti-trans agenda.
Primary Source Title: "U.S. Department of Education to Investigate Title IX Violations in Athletics"

Name of Action: DOGE attempts to access federal student data
Topic: Regulations
What It Says: Tried to access federal student data without clearance
What It Means: Clear FERPA violation
Status: TRO granted in part; access blocked until March 10
Challenges to Action: American Federation of Teachers v. Bessent, 8:25-cv-00430 – CourtListener.com

Name of Action: Executive Order targeting trans student athletes
Topic: Regulations, LGBTQ+, Title IX, Civil Rights, PK-12 School Funding, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: Halts federal funding for educational institutions that allow transgender women and girls to compete in women's and girls' sports.
What It Means: Further adheres to POTUS 2-gender policy. Leaves trans women athletes with no avenues for participation in sports.
Challenges to Action: Students and Families Move to Challenge Trump Executive Order Banning Transgender Sports Participation - GLAD Law
Notes: GLAD is trying to expand a NH state challenge to encompass this EO.
Primary Source Title: "Keeping Men out of Women's Sports"

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education removes all gender options on the FAFSA except male and female.
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Civil Rights, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Description in title.
What It Means: Part of administration's ongoing targeting of trans and non-binary individuals' identity.
Primary Source Title: "U.S. Department of Education Announces Improvements to the FAFSA Form"

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education investigates allegations of antisemitism at five universities
Topic: DEI, Civil Rights, Postsecondary, Campus Climate
What It Says: Claims there was widespread antisemitic harrassment on campuses during protests against Israel-Hamas war.
What It Means: Implications for free speech and academic freedom in postsecondary institutions.
Primary Source Title: "U.S. Department of Education Probes Cases of Antisemitism of Five Universities"

Name of Action: Disbanding of Federal School Safety Clearinghouse External Advisory Board
Topic: PK-12 Schools, Regulations, Governance
What It Says: No explanation given. Members are allowed to reapply for membership of the 26-member commission. Board was charged with advising on school safety issues.
What It Means: Ron Nazoe of NASSP was the chair.
News & Commentary: The Trump administration disbanded a federal school safety board. Now what? | K-12 Dive

Name of Action: Trump admin puts all USAID staff on leave; reduction in force of 1,600 personnel
Topic: Federal Workforce, International Education, Postsecondary Funding, PK-12 School Funding, Program Funding
What It Says: Description in title.
What It Means: Cutting US funding for PK-20 programs around the world.
Notes: Also: pause in foreign assistance funding via USAID on 1/26/25
Additional Info: Implementing the President’s Executive Order on Reevaluating and Realigning United States Foreign Aid

Name of Action: Department of Education workers put on leave
Topic: DEI, Federal Workforce, Civil Rights
What It Says: 50 ED workers who work on DEI initiatives were put on administrative leave.
What It Means: ED is purging DEI work.
Notes: multiple lawsuits from fed worker unions, but perhaps none specific to ED.

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education changes charter school regulations and allocates grants for them
Topic: School Choice, PK-12 School Funding, Regulations
What It Says: Removed Biden admin requirements for charter certification. Allocated $33 million in grants to charter management organizations.
Primary Source Title: U.S. Department of Education Advances School Choice by Supporting Charter Schools

Name of Action: Department of Ed Office for Civil Rights reverts Title IX protections to 2020 rules, namely only covering biological women.
Topic: LGBTQ+, DEI, Regulations, Civil Rights
What It Says: Description in title.
What It Means: Trans and nonbinary people no longer have Title IX protections, impacting all postsecondary Title IX offices.
Primary Source Title: Enforcement of Executive Order Defending Women

Name of Action: Executive Order bans race-conscious admissions at military academies and educational institutions
Topic: DEI, Federal Workforce, Postsecondary
What It Says: Department of Defense also bans race-conscious events and clubs at military academies and other institutions.
What It Means: Supreme Court has explicitly left race-conscious admissions intact for military academies.
Primary Source Title: Restoring America's Fighting Force

Name of Action: Office of Personnel Management removes gender data from federal websites, including the Youth Risk Behavior Survey
Topic: LGBTQ+, DEI, Title IX, Civil Rights
What It Says: Description in title.
What It Means: Targets the identities of trans and nonbinary people.
Primary Source Title: Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump's Executive Order Defending Women

Name of Action: Executive Order directs agency heads to give guidance to states to expanding school choice
Topic: School Choice, PK-12 School Funding
What It Says: Agencies include Department of Ed; Health and Human Services, Department of Defense, Department of Interior.
What It Means: Includes private and faith-based schools.
Primary Source Title: Expanding Educational Freedom and Opportunity for Families

Name of Action: Executive Order targeting schools that address diversity, equity, and inclusion.
Topic: DEI, Civil Rights, Regulations, Program Funding, PK-12 School Funding, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: Suspends funding for schools that address DEI and transgender issues; requires plan from Department of Ed to end "indoctrination in K-12 education"; and reinstates the 1776 Commission.
What It Means: Attempt to eliminate DEI and gender inclusion in educational institutions. 1776 commission promotes a conservative worldview that minimizes the truth about slavery.
Primary Source Title: Ending Radical Endoctrination in K-12 Schooling

Name of Action: Executive Order targeting student protests on college campuses
Topic: Civil Rights, DEI, Academic Freedom, Campus Climate
What It Says: Directs Justice Department to investigate what it describes as antisemitism on campuses and encourages colleges to "monitor for and report activities by alien students and staff."
What It Means: Targets college campuses after protests against Israel-Hamas war and combines focus with POTUS focus on immigration and immigrant students.
Primary Source Title: Additional Measures to Combat Antisemitism

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Launches Investigation into Denver Public Schools for Converting Girl's Restroom to All-Gender Facility
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Civil Rights, Regulations
What It Says: Investigation over a gender-inclusive bathroom. Denver voted that all schools should have one in 2020.
What It Means: Attacking specific districts that implement inclusive practices.

Name of Action: Freeze on all federal financial assistance programs and supporting activities
Topic: Research Funding, Program Funding, DEI, LGBTQ+, Federal Workforce, PK-12 School Funding, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: Funding freeze on federal grants and loans across federal agencies. This includes HHS, which oversees Headstart.
What It Means: Rapid rollout with virtually no guidance or communication led to chaos and uncertainty about how federal employees were to carry out the directive. Some agencies couldn't access funds even after the injuction was ordered.
Status: Blocked by court orders, and White House has walked back the memo. Still requiring reviews of programs under EOs.
Primary Source: Trump Orders Pause on Federal Financial Assistance | Lawfare
Challenges to Action: NATIONAL COUNCIL OF NONPROFITS v. OFFICE OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET, 1:25-cv-00239 – CourtListener.com
News & Commentary: Statement of AAU President Barbara Snyder on January 27 OMB Memo Pausing American Scientific Advancement

Name of Action: Executive Order targets transgender students and others
Topic: Healthcare, LGBTQ+, Civil Rights, Title IX
What It Says: Halts federal funding for gender-affirming care for minors, including to hospitals and medical schools. Reverses Title IX protections for transgender people.
What It Means: Further adheres to POTUS 2-gender policy. Could have implications for school, including mental health and medical services.
Primary Source Title: Protecting Children from Chemical and Surgical Mutilation

Name of Action: End to Biden-Era book ban investigations
Topic: Civil Rights, Curriculum
What It Says: Ends ED OCR investigations into complaints of book bans. Biden admin said that book bans could infringe on civil rights.
What It Means: Schools and municipalities might have greater latitude in restricting books available to students and the public.
News & Commentary: Education Department rescinds Biden-era book ban guidance | K-12 Dive

Name of Action: Dept of Ed appointments and nominations
Topic: Federal Workforce
What It Says: Rachel Oglesby, Jonathan Pidluzny, Chase Forrester, Steve Warzoha, Tom Wheeler, Craig Trainor, Madi Bierdermann, Candice Jackson, Joshua Kleinfeld, Hannah Ruth Earl
What It Means: Strong presence of alums from America First Policy Institute

Name of Action: ICE entry into schools, colleges, houses of worship (can't find formal title; directive from Acting Secretary)
Topic: Immigration, Civil Rights
What It Says: ICE and other immigration agents can enter houses of worship, schools, and colleges to apprehend people.
What It Means: Major change to longstanding practice of foregoing entering sensitive/protected areas like schools, churches, shelters.
Challenges to Action: Denver Public Schools v. Noem, 1:25-cv-00474 – CourtListener.com
Additional Info: MENNONITE CHURCH USA v. U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY, 1:25-cv-00403 – CourtListener.com
Fallout: Philadelphia Yearly Meeting of the Religious Society of Friends v. U.S. Department of Homeland..., 8:25-cv-00243 – CourtListener.com

Name of Action: Executive Order targets DEI efforts in state and local agencies and institutions of higher education
Topic: DEI, Federal Workforce, PK-12 Schools, Postsecondary, Civil Rights
What It Says: Directs Secretary of Education to issue guidance to state and local agencies and institutions of higher educaton about compliance practices and measures.
What It Means: Lays out adminstration rationale for DEI ban as a violation of civil rights law.
Notes: Legal challenge brought by National Association of Diversity Officers in Higher Education
Primary Source Title: Ending Illegal Discrimination and Restoring Merit-based Opportunity

Name of Action: Executive Order terminates DEI efforts in the federal government
Topic: DEI, Federal Workforce, Civil Rights, Postsecondary, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Terminates DEI efforts in federal government, including positions. Also covers federal contracts and grants.
What It Means: Major uncertainty for compliace by PK-20 institutions under contract.
Status: Feb. 21: federal judge temporarily blocked Trump from terminating contracts that the admin considers equity-oriented.
Notes: This is the same legal challenge as the EO above.
Primary Source Title: Ending Radical and Wasteful Government DEI Programs and Preferencing

Name of Action: Return to In-Person Work
Topic: Federal Workforce
What It Says: Requires all federal employees, including Department of Ed, to return to in-person work. Deadline Feb 24 for most and June 1 for some.
